column4: I've set the root password on my newly installed Ubuntu 8.04 system. It appears to have altered the sudo system so that I cannot run Synaptic from the menu. What would definitive answer be for this?
It shouldn't have made any difference at all. How did you set it?
I'm not sure you've done what you think you've done at all..

well, that should not have caused the problem... although I still would not recommend setting a root password unless you have a very specific idea of why you need it (and if you know what you're doing, you'll see that even then you actually don't need it!)
setting the root password should not have caused your problem though. You must have done something more than just setting the root password
finally, progress...ok well other stuff ive done are: install the infernal citrix client and uninstall it and install it again
so you mentioned that doing sudo passwd should not cause this issue: "ï»¿Unable to copy the user's Xauthorization file" ?
yes. Just setting a root password should not cause that. I don't know what does.
so the problem is gksu picking up your Xauthority ... I suspect just logging out and back in might be enough to fix it
so setting root's password would cause this issue then? as it could have tinkered with sudo related config files?
I'm lazy.. I never really understood how Xauthority works. But I think it generates tokens when you first log in.. logging out and back in should regerate them
Not sure how they'd have got messed up. I'm sure just setting a root password wouldn't do it.
well, that might help. I never bothered figuring it out too much. I know how to turn all the xauth off so I can launch windows from anywhere without having to use ssh -X :)
ahhh.. that would be a problem :)
that would probably explain the gksu problem too.. likely it tries to make tmp files
